gvprojects.superttt.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • gvprojects.superttt.model.Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gvprojects.sttt.model.ISuperTicTacToeModel

    public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements gvprojects.sttt.model.ISuperTicTacToeModel
    The model for the SuperTicTacToe Game to run off of. It will play a game of STTT and will detect wrap around win in both columns and rows. It throws exceptions when needed.
    Version:
    2/13/13 Winter 2013
    Author:
    Justin Rohr

      • Model

        public Model(int r,
     int c,
     int win_length)
        Constructor that takes the row, column, and win size parameters for the game and checks their validity. Then it creates a game given those parameters
        Parameters:
        r - the number of rows on the board
        c - the number of columns on the board
        win_length - the win length for the game

        Parameters:
        r - the row for the cell to be undone
        c - the column for the cell to be undone

      • select

        public void select(int r,
          int c)
        Validates the Rows and Columns and throws a RunTimeError if the Cell is already filled. Otherwise, it checks the playerturn and fills the Cell with the players CellState and adds to the playerturn
        Specified by:
        select in interface gvprojects.sttt.model.ISuperTicTacToeModel

      • checkForWin

        public static gvprojects.sttt.model.GameStatus checkForWin(gvprojects.sttt.model.CellState[][] game_board,
                                           int win_length)
        Checks for win on the game board, first checks to see if the board is null. Then checks to see who won by calling a private static helper method that returns the status of the current game board
        Parameters:
        game_board - the game board to be passed and checked
        win_length - the length of the win to be checked
        Returns:
        the current status of the game
